result.execSummary:
Kirk D. Curtis was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Kirk D. Curtis was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kirk D. Curtis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: (2:42) Defendant Kirk D. Curtis in court, in custody w/o counsel (has waived SPD). Robert Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. has rec'd copy of Fugitive Complaint; Court reviews rights and charges; Court reviews right to counsel; Def. is willing to waive; Def. to be released next week; Def. now wishes to challenge the extradition and wants a Gov. Warrant; State notes that Def. would be transferred from prison to our jail until matter can be resolved; further discussion; Def. now wishes to waive extradition and be transferred to Illinois asap; documents discussed, signed by all and distributed; Def. remanded
Told to open; original complaint coming; to be scheduled some time on Friday
